description: Food and grocery delivery firm Swiggy has filed an updated prospectus for its proposed initial public offering (IPO) comprising a fresh issue of Rs 3,750 crore and an offer for sale of 185.3 million shares. Here are the key things to know about the issue, the company's financials and competition.
content: Food and grocery delivery company Swiggy is set to take on rival Zomato in the public markets, as the company filed its updated draft papers with capital markets regulator Sebi on Thursday for a Rs 10,000-crore initial public offering (IPO).Here's a look at key things to know about the issue:IPO detailsThe proposed IPO comprises a fresh issue of equity shares worth Rs 3,750 crore and an offer for sale (OFS) of 18.52 crore equity shares by existing shareholders, according to the updated draft red herring prospectus (UDRHP). Swiggy has called an EGM to increase this to Rs 5,000 crore or $600 million.Investors including Prosus, Accel, Norwest Venture Partners, Tencent, Elevation Capital and Alpha Wave Global will partially sell their stakes via the OFS route. Japanese investor SoftBank is not selling any shares in the IPO.Prosus, the largest investor in Swiggy with a 30.95% stake or 690.5 million shares, is selling 118.2 million shares or 5% stake for over $500 million. Prosus' share sale will make up over 60% of the whole OFS component.Also Read | Zepto in talks with investment banks for potential IPO next yearBiggest IPO since Paytm
